paper_title: On Vector Spaces with Formal Infinite Sums
abstract: We discuss possible definitions of categories of vector spaces over a fixed field $\mathbf{k}$ enriched with a notion of formal infinite linear combination in the likes of the formal infinite linear combinations one has in the context of generalized power series. We call these \emph{categories of reasonable strong vector spaces} (c.r.s.v.s.). We show that, in a precise sense, the more general possible definition for a reasonable strong vector space is that of a small $\mathbf{k}$-additive endofunctor of $\mathrm{Vect}_\mathbf{k}$ such that for every cardinal $λ$ there are no non-zero natural transformations from $\mathrm{Vect}(\mathbf{k},-)^λ/\mathrm{Vect}(\mathbf{k}, -)^{\oplus λ}$ to $X$. We denote the category such functors $Σ\mathrm{Vect}$. We compare $Σ\mathrm{Vect}$ to the category of ``naive" strong vector spaces $BΣ\mathrm{Vect}$ constructed in a specific way and to the c.r.s.v.s. $K\mathrm{TVect}_s$ of separated linearly topologized spaces that are generated by linearly compact spaces. We study the number of iterations of a natural approximate reflector on $\mathrm{Ind}\text{-}(\mathrm{Vect}^{\text{op}})$ needed to construct the orthogonal reflector onto $Σ\mathrm{Vect}$ because it relates to the problem of constructing the smallest subspace of an $X \in Σ\mathrm{Vect}$ closed under taking infinite linear combinations containing a given linear subspace of $H$ of $X$. We give a complete answer in the case $X$ is $\aleph_1$-ary. Finally we show how the natural monoidal closed structure on $\mathrm{Ind}\text{-}(\mathrm{Vect}^{\text{op}})$ induces one on $Σ\mathrm{Vect}$ and apply this to define an infinite-sum-sensitive notion of Kähler differentials for generalized power series. Most of the technical results apply to a more general class of reflective subcategories of $\mathrm{Ind}\text{-}(\mathrm{Vect}^{\text{op}})$.
